title: Environmental Awareness
description: Listen to a discussion about protecting the environment.

audio.text:
Emma: Have you heard about the new recycling program in our city?
Tom: Yes, I saw something about it in the news. What's changing?
Emma: Well, they're making it easier to recycle more types of plastic. Before, we could only recycle numbers one and two, but now we can recycle up to number five.
Tom: That's great news. I always felt bad throwing away so much plastic.
Emma: Me too. But recycling is just one part of the solution. I think we need to reduce how much we use in the first place.
Tom: You're right. I've been trying to use fewer disposable products. I bought a reusable water bottle and coffee cup.
Emma: That's a good start. I've also switched to cloth bags instead of plastic ones. It takes some getting used to, but it's worth it.
Tom: The more people do these small things, the bigger the impact will be.
Emma: Exactly. I read that if everyone reduced their plastic use by just twenty percent, it would make a huge difference.
Tom: What else can we do? I want to reduce my carbon footprint more.
Emma: Well, eating less meat is one of the most effective things you can do. The meat industry produces more greenhouse gases than all transportation combined.
Tom: Really? I had no idea. That's much more than I expected.
Emma: Yes, it's surprising. You don't have to become vegetarian, but even cutting down to meat three or four times a week helps.
Tom: I could probably do that. What about transportation?
Emma: Using public transport is far better than driving alone. Or better yet, cycling or walking when possible.
Tom: The weather is getting nicer, so maybe I'll start cycling to work. It would be good for my health too.
Emma: That's a great idea. Every little change helps.
